alert.note: Alert for Barton; Cedar; Dade; St. Clair; Vernon (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 05 at 7:48PM CST by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Barton, Cedar, southwestern St. Clair, southeastern Vernon and northwestern Dade Counties through 830 PM CST... At 747 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from El Dorado Springs to 6 miles southeast of Liberal. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Prairie State Park... Stockton State Park... Stockton Lake... Lamar... El Dorado Springs... Stockton... Golden City... Liberal... Sheldon... Montevallo... Jerico Springs... Lamar Heights... Roscoe... Irwin... Arcola... Umber View Heights... Milford... Arnica... Sylvania... Oakton... This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 62 and 82. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Barton; Cedar; Dade; St. Clair; Vernon
